definition: a passage (as in a theater or railroad passenger car) separating sections of seats, such a passage regarded as separating opposing parties in a legislature
examples: supported by members on both sides of the aisle

definition: a passage (as in a store or warehouse) for inside traffic
the side of a church nave separated by piers from the nave proper

examples: Prenuptial agreements have long been used by couples who want to set down the terms of any future divorce before they walk down the aisle.
